message.content:
<<<api>>>: JSONArray, JSONObject
<<<code>>>: JSONArray jsonArray = new JSONArray(str);
for(int i=0; i<jsonArray.length(); i++){
  JSONObject jsonObject = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i);
  Iterator<String> keys = jsonObject.keys();
  while(keys.hasNext()){
    String key = keys.next();
    JSONArray values = jsonObject.getJSONArray(key);
    String name = key;
    String value = values.getString(0);
    String stock = values.getString(1);
    // create Fruit object and set the values
    Fruit fruit = new Fruit();
    fruit.setName(name);
    fruit.setValue(value);
    fruit.setStock(stock);
    // do something with the fruit object
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: First, you need to create a JSONArray object from the string parameter using JSONArray jsonArray = new JSONArray(str). Then, iterate through the jsonArray using a for loop. Inside the loop, get the JSONObject at each index using JSONObject jsonObject = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i). Use the keys() method to get an iterator of the keys in the JSONObject. Iterate through the keys using a while loop and get the JSONArray values using jsonObject.getJSONArray(key). Finally, create a Fruit object, set the values, and do something with the fruit object.
